32 | | /** 33 | | * @dev Percentage share of fees for each referrer address 34 | | */ 35 | | mapping(address => uint256) referrerShare; 36 | | /** 37 | | * @dev previously maxCollateralAmounts[collateralId] was used in storage slot 38 | | */ 39 | | // solhint-disable-next-line var-name-mixedcase 40 | | mapping(uint128 => uint256) __unused_1; 41 | | /** 42 | | * @dev previously synth deduction priority 43 | | */ 44 | | // solhint-disable-next-line var-name-mixedcase 45 | | uint128[] __unused_2; 46 | | /** 47 | | * @dev minimum configured keeper reward for the sender who liquidates the account 48 | | */ 49 | | uint256 minKeeperRewardUsd; 50 | | /** 51 | | * @dev maximum configured keeper reward for the sender who liquidates the account 52 | | */ 53 | | uint256 maxKeeperRewardUsd; 54 | | /** 55 | | * @dev maximum configured number of concurrent positions per account. 56 | | * @notice If set to zero it means no new positions can be opened, but existing positions can be increased or decreased. 57 | | * @notice If set to a larger number (larger than number of markets created) it means is unlimited. 58 | | */ 59 | | uint128 maxPositionsPerAccount; 60 | | /** 61 | | * @dev maximum configured number of concurrent collaterals per account. 62 | | * @notice If set to zero it means no new collaterals can be added accounts, but existing collaterals can be increased or decreased. 63 | | * @notice If set to a larger number (larger than number of collaterals enabled) it means is unlimited. 64 | | */ 65 | | uint128 maxCollateralsPerAccount; 66 | | /** 67 | | * @dev used together with minKeeperRewardUsd to get the minumum keeper reward for the sender who settles, or liquidates the account 68 | | */ 69 | | uint256 minKeeperProfitRatioD18; 70 | | /** 71 | | * @dev used together with maxKeeperRewardUsd to get the maximum keeper reward for the sender who settles, or liquidates the account 72 | | */ 73 | | uint256 maxKeeperScalingRatioD18; 74 | | /** 75 | | * @dev set of supported collateral types. By supported we mean collateral types that have a maxCollateralAmount > 0 76 | | */ 77 | | SetUtil.UintSet supportedCollateralTypes; 78 | | /** 79 | | * @dev interest rate gradient applied to utilization prior to hitting the gradient breakpoint 80 | | */ 81 | | uint128 lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient; 82 | | /** 83 | | * @dev breakpoint at which the interest rate gradient changes from low to high 84 | | */ 85 | | uint128 interestRateGradientBreakpoint; 86 | | /** 87 | | * @dev interest rate gradient applied to utilization after hitting the gradient breakpoint 88 | | */ 89 | | uint128 highUtilizationInterestRateGradient; 90 | | /** 91 | | * @dev ratio of the collateral liquidation reward. 1e18 is 100%. 92 | | */ 93 | | uint128 collateralLiquidateRewardRatioD18; 94 | | /** 95 | | * @dev reward distributor implementation. This is used as a base to be cloned to distribute rewards to the liquidator. 96 | | */ 97 | | address rewardDistributorImplementation; 98 | | } 99 | | 100 | * | function load() internal pure returns (Data storage globalMarketConfig) { 101 | * | bytes32 s = _SLOT_GLOBAL_PERPS_MARKET_CONFIGURATION; 102 | | assembly { 103 | | globalMarketConfig.slot := s 104 | | } 105 | | } 106 | | 107 | * | function loadInterestRateParameters() internal view returns (uint128, uint128, uint128) { 108 | * | Data storage self = load(); 109 | | return ( 110 | * | self.lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient, 111 | * | self.interestRateGradientBreakpoint, 112 | * | self.highUtilizationInterestRateGradient 113 | | ); 114 | | } 115 | | 116 | * | function minimumKeeperRewardCap( 117 | | Data storage self, 118 | | uint256 costOfExecutionInUsd 119 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256) { 120 | | return 121 | * | MathUtil.max( 122 | * | costOfExecutionInUsd + self.minKeeperRewardUsd, 123 | * | costOfExecutionInUsd.mulDecimal(self.minKeeperProfitRatioD18 + DecimalMath.UNIT) 124 | | ); 125 | | } 126 | | 127 | * | function maximumKeeperRewardCap( 128 | | Data storage self, 129 | | uint256 availableMarginInUsd 130 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256) { 131 | | // Note: if availableMarginInUsd is zero, it means the account was flagged, so the maximumKeeperRewardCap will just be maxKeeperRewardUsd 132 | * | if (availableMarginInUsd == 0) { 133 | * | return self.maxKeeperRewardUsd; 134 | | } 135 | | 136 | | return 137 | * | MathUtil.min( 138 | * | availableMarginInUsd.mulDecimal(self.maxKeeperScalingRatioD18), 139 | * | self.maxKeeperRewardUsd 140 | | ); 141 | | } 142 | | 143 | | /** 144 | | * @dev returns the keeper reward based on total keeper rewards from all markets compared against min/max 145 | | */ 146 | * | function keeperReward( 147 | | Data storage self, 148 | | uint256 keeperRewards, 149 | | uint256 costOfExecutionInUsd, 150 | | uint256 availableMarginInUsd 151 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256) { 152 | * | uint256 minCap = minimumKeeperRewardCap(self, costOfExecutionInUsd); 153 | * | uint256 maxCap = maximumKeeperRewardCap(self, availableMarginInUsd); 154 | * | return MathUtil.min(MathUtil.max(minCap, keeperRewards + costOfExecutionInUsd), maxCap); 155 | | } 156 | | 157 | * | function collectFees( 158 | | Data storage self, 159 | | uint256 orderFees, 160 | | address referrer, 161 | | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage factory 162 | * | ) internal returns (uint256 referralFees, uint256 feeCollectorFees) { 163 | * | referralFees = _collectReferrerFees(self, orderFees, referrer, factory); 164 | * | uint256 remainingFees = orderFees - referralFees; 165 | | 166 | * | if (remainingFees == 0 || self.feeCollector == IFeeCollector(address(0))) { 167 | * | return (referralFees, 0); 168 | | } 169 | | 170 | | uint256 feeCollectorQuote = self.feeCollector.quoteFees( 171 | | factory.perpsMarketId, 172 | | remainingFees, 173 | | ERC2771Context._msgSender() 174 | | ); 175 | | 176 | | if (feeCollectorQuote == 0) { 177 | | return (referralFees, 0); 178 | | } 179 | | 180 | | if (feeCollectorQuote > remainingFees) { 181 | | feeCollectorQuote = remainingFees; 182 | | } 183 | | 184 | | factory.withdrawMarketUsd(address(self.feeCollector), feeCollectorQuote); 185 | | 186 | | return (referralFees, feeCollectorQuote); 187 | | } 188 | | 189 | * | function calculateCollateralLiquidateReward( 190 | | Data storage self, 191 | | uint256 notionalValue 192 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256) { 193 | * | return notionalValue.mulDecimal(self.collateralLiquidateRewardRatioD18); 194 | | } 195 | | 196 | | function updateSupportedCollaterals( 197 | | Data storage self, 198 | | uint128 collateralId, 199 | | uint256 maxCollateralAmount 200 | | ) internal { 201 | | bool isSupportedCollateral = self.supportedCollateralTypes.contains(collateralId); 202 | | if (maxCollateralAmount > 0 && !isSupportedCollateral) { 203 | | self.supportedCollateralTypes.add(collateralId.to256()); 204 | | } else if (maxCollateralAmount == 0 && isSupportedCollateral) { 205 | | self.supportedCollateralTypes.remove(collateralId.to256()); 206 | | } 207 | | } 208 | | 209 | * | function _collectReferrerFees( 210 | | Data storage self, 211 | | uint256 fees, 212 | | address referrer, 213 | | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage factory 214 | * | ) private returns (uint256 referralFeesSent) { 215 | * | if (fees == 0 || referrer == address(0)) { 216 | * | return 0; 217 | | } 218 | | 219 | | uint256 referrerShareRatio = self.referrerShare[referrer]; 220 | | if (referrerShareRatio > 0) { 221 | | referralFeesSent = fees.mulDecimal(referrerShareRatio); 222 | | factory.withdrawMarketUsd(referrer, referralFeesSent); 223 | | } 224 | | } 225 | | } 226 | |

3 | | 4 | | import {SafeCastU256, SafeCastU128, SafeCastI256} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/utils/SafeCast.sol"; 5 | | import {DecimalMath} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/utils/DecimalMath.sol"; 6 | | import {GlobalPerpsMarket} from "./GlobalPerpsMarket.sol"; 7 | | import {Position} from "./Position.sol"; 8 | | import {PerpsPrice} from "./PerpsPrice.sol"; 9 | | import {GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration} from "../storage/GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration.sol"; 10 | | 11 | | library InterestRate { 12 | | using DecimalMath for uint256; 13 | | using DecimalMath for uint128; 14 | | using SafeCastU128 for uint128; 15 | | using SafeCastU256 for uint256; 16 | | using SafeCastI256 for int256; 17 | | using GlobalPerpsMarket for GlobalPerpsMarket.Data; 18 | | using Position for Position.Data; 19 | | // 4 year average which includes leap 20 | * | uint256 private constant AVERAGE_SECONDS_PER_YEAR = 31557600; 21 | | 22 | | bytes32 private constant _SLOT_INTEREST_RATE = 23 | * | keccak256(abi.encode("io.synthetix.perps-market.InterestRate")); 24 | | 25 | | struct Data { 26 | | uint256 interestAccrued; // per $1 of OI 27 | | uint128 interestRate; 28 | | uint256 lastTimestamp; 29 | | } 30 | | 31 | * | function load() internal pure returns (Data storage interestRate) { 32 | * | bytes32 s = _SLOT_INTEREST_RATE; 33 | | assembly { 34 | | interestRate.slot := s 35 | | } 36 | | } 37 | | 38 | * | function update( 39 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance priceTolerance 40 | * | ) internal returns (uint128 newInterestRate, uint256 currentInterestAccrued) { 41 | * | Data storage self = load(); 42 | | 43 | * | ( 44 | * | uint128 lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient, 45 | * | uint128 interestRateGradientBreakpoint, 46 | * | uint128 highUtilizationInterestRateGradient 47 | * | ) = GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration.loadInterestRateParameters(); 48 | | 49 | | // if no interest parameters are set, interest rate is 0 and the interest accrued stays the same 50 | * | if ( 51 | * | lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient == 0 && 52 | * | interestRateGradientBreakpoint == 0 && 53 | * | highUtilizationInterestRateGradient == 0 54 | | ) { 55 | * | self.interestRate = 0; 56 | * | return (0, self.interestAccrued); 57 | | } 58 | | 59 | | (uint128 currentUtilizationRate, , ) = GlobalPerpsMarket.load().utilizationRate( 60 | | priceTolerance 61 | | ); 62 | | 63 | | self.interestAccrued = calculateNextInterest(self); 64 | | 65 | | self.interestRate = currentInterestRate( 66 | | currentUtilizationRate, 67 | | lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient, 68 | | interestRateGradientBreakpoint, 69 | | highUtilizationInterestRateGradient 70 | | ); 71 | | self.lastTimestamp = block.timestamp; 72 | | 73 | | return (self.interestRate, self.interestAccrued); 74 | | } 75 | | 76 | * | function proportionalElapsed(Data storage self) internal view returns (uint128) { 77 | | // even though timestamps here are not D18, divDecimal multiplies by 1e18 to preserve decimals into D18 78 | * | return (block.timestamp - self.lastTimestamp).divDecimal(AVERAGE_SECONDS_PER_YEAR).to128(); 79 | | } 80 | | 81 | * | function calculateNextInterest(Data storage self) internal view returns (uint256) { 82 | * | return self.interestAccrued + unrecordedInterest(self); 83 | | } 84 | | 85 | * | function unrecordedInterest(Data storage self) internal view returns (uint256) { 86 | * | return self.interestRate.mulDecimalUint128(proportionalElapsed(self)).to256(); 87 | | } 88 | | 89 | | function currentInterestRate( 90 | | uint128 currentUtilizationRate, 91 | | uint128 lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient, 92 | | uint128 interestRateGradientBreakpoint, 93 | | uint128 highUtilizationInterestRateGradient 94 | | ) internal pure returns (uint128 rate) { 95 | | // if utilization rate is below breakpoint, multiply low utilization * # of percentage points of utilizationRate 96 | | // otherwise multiply low utilization until breakpoint, then use high utilization gradient for the rest 97 | | if (currentUtilizationRate < interestRateGradientBreakpoint) { 98 | | rate = 99 | | lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient.mulDecimalUint128(currentUtilizationRate) * 100 | | 100; 101 | | } else { 102 | | uint128 highUtilizationRate = currentUtilizationRate - interestRateGradientBreakpoint; 103 | | uint128 highUtilizationRateInterest = highUtilizationInterestRateGradient 104 | | .mulDecimalUint128(highUtilizationRate) * 100; 105 | | uint128 lowUtilizationRateInterest = lowUtilizationInterestRateGradient 106 | | .mulDecimalUint128(interestRateGradientBreakpoint) * 100; 107 | | rate = highUtilizationRateInterest + lowUtilizationRateInterest; 108 | | } 109 | | } 110 | | } 111 | |
/Users/vladimirdzotov/Dropbox/do/GA/synthetix/synthetix-perps-minimal/markets/perps-market/contracts/storage/KeeperCosts.sol 1 | | //SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.8.11 <0.9.0; 10 | | 11 | | uint128 constant SNX_USD_MARKET_ID = 0; 12 | | 13 | | /** 14 | | * @title Keeper txn execution costs for rewards calculation based on gas price 15 | | */ 16 | | library KeeperCosts { 17 | | using SafeCastI256 for int256; 18 | | using SetUtil for SetUtil.UintSet; 19 | | using PerpsAccount for PerpsAccount.Data; 20 | | using PerpsMarketConfiguration for PerpsMarketConfiguration.Data; 21 | | 22 | * | uint256 private constant KIND_SETTLEMENT = 0; 23 | * | uint256 private constant KIND_FLAG = 1; 24 | * | uint256 private constant KIND_LIQUIDATE = 2; 25 | | 26 | | struct Data { 27 | | bytes32 keeperCostNodeId; 28 | | } 29 | | 30 | * | function load() internal pure returns (Data storage price) { 31 | * | bytes32 s = keccak256(abi.encode("io.synthetix.perps-market.KeeperCosts")); 32 | | assembly { 33 | | price.slot := s 34 | | } 35 | | } 36 | | 37 | | function update(Data storage self, bytes32 keeperCostNodeId) internal { 38 | | self.keeperCostNodeId = keeperCostNodeId; 39 | | } 40 | | 41 | * | function getSettlementKeeperCosts(Data storage self) internal view returns (uint256 sUSDCost) { 42 | * | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage factory = PerpsMarketFactory.load(); 43 | | 44 | * | sUSDCost = _processWithRuntime(self.keeperCostNodeId, factory, 0, KIND_SETTLEMENT); 45 | | } 46 | | 47 | * | function getFlagKeeperCosts( 48 | | Data storage self, 49 | | uint128 accountId 50 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256 sUSDCost) { 51 | * | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage factory = PerpsMarketFactory.load(); 52 | | 53 | * | PerpsAccount.Data storage account = PerpsAccount.load(accountId); 54 | * | uint256 numberOfCollateralFeeds = account.activeCollateralTypes.contains(SNX_USD_MARKET_ID) 55 | * | ? account.activeCollateralTypes.length() - 1 56 | * | : account.activeCollateralTypes.length(); 57 | * | uint256 numberOfUpdatedFeeds = numberOfCollateralFeeds + 58 | * | account.openPositionMarketIds.length(); 59 | | 60 | * | sUSDCost = _processWithRuntime( 61 | * | self.keeperCostNodeId, 62 | * | factory, 63 | * | numberOfUpdatedFeeds, 64 | | KIND_FLAG 65 | | ); 66 | | } 67 | | 68 | * | function getLiquidateKeeperCosts(Data storage self) internal view returns (uint256 sUSDCost) { 69 | * | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage factory = PerpsMarketFactory.load(); 70 | | 71 | * | sUSDCost = _processWithRuntime(self.keeperCostNodeId, factory, 0, KIND_LIQUIDATE); 72 | | } 73 | | 74 | * | function _processWithRuntime( 75 | | bytes32 keeperCostNodeId, 76 | | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage factory, 77 | | uint256 numberOfUpdatedFeeds, 78 | | uint256 executionKind 79 | * | ) private view returns (uint256 sUSDCost) { 80 | * | bytes32[] memory runtimeKeys = new bytes32[](4); 81 | * | bytes32[] memory runtimeValues = new bytes32[](4); 82 | * | runtimeKeys[0] = bytes32("numberOfUpdatedFeeds"); 83 | * | runtimeKeys[1] = bytes32("executionKind"); 84 | * | runtimeValues[0] = bytes32(numberOfUpdatedFeeds); 85 | * | runtimeValues[1] = bytes32(executionKind); 86 | | 87 | * | sUSDCost = INodeModule(factory.oracle) 88 | * | .processWithRuntime(keeperCostNodeId, runtimeKeys, runtimeValues) 89 | | .price 90 | | .toUint(); 91 | | } 92 | | } 93 | |

/Users/vladimirdzotov/Dropbox/do/GA/synthetix/synthetix-perps-minimal/markets/perps-market/contracts/storage/LiquidationAssetManager.sol 1 | | //SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.8.11 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | import {ERC165Helper} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/utils/ERC165Helper.sol"; 5 | | import {ITokenModule} from "@synthetixio/core-modules/contracts/interfaces/ITokenModule.sol"; 6 | | import {RewardsDistributor} from "@synthetixio/rewards-distributor/src/RewardsDistributor.sol"; 7 | | import {IRewardDistributor} from "@synthetixio/main/contracts/interfaces/external/IRewardDistributor.sol"; 8 | | import {ISynthetixSystem} from "../interfaces/external/ISynthetixSystem.sol"; 9 | | import {GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration} from "./GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration.sol"; 10 | | import {PerpsMarketFactory} from "./PerpsMarketFactory.sol"; 11 | | import {DecimalMath} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/utils/DecimalMath.sol"; 12 | | import {AddressUtil} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/utils/AddressUtil.sol"; 13 | | import {AddressError} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/errors/AddressError.sol"; 14 | | import {ParameterError} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/errors/ParameterError.sol"; 15 | | import {IDistributorErrors} from "../interfaces/IDistributorErrors.sol"; 16 | | 17 | | /** 18 | | * @title LiquidationAssetManager send liquidity to the reward distributor according to each collateral type 19 | | */ 20 | | library LiquidationAssetManager { 21 | | using DecimalMath for uint256; 22 | | 23 | | struct Data { 24 | | /** 25 | | * @dev Collateral Id (same as synth id) 26 | | */ 27 | | uint128 id; 28 | | /** 29 | | * @dev Distributor address used for reward distribution. If address is 0x0, a new distributor will be created. 30 | | */ 31 | | address distributor; 32 | | /** 33 | | * @dev Addresses of collateral types delegated to the pool. Used to distribute rewards. 34 | | * @dev Needs to be manually maintained in synch with pool configuration to distribute proportionally to all LPs. 35 | | */ 36 | | address[] poolDelegatedCollateralTypes; 37 | | } 38 | | 39 | | function setValidPoolDelegatedCollateralTypes( 40 | | Data storage self, 41 | | address[] calldata poolDelegatedCollateralTypes 42 | | ) internal { 43 | | self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes = poolDelegatedCollateralTypes; 44 | | 45 | | // Collaterals in a V3 pool can be delegated to a specific market. `collateralTypes` are the pool collateral 46 | | // addresses delegated to this market. They're tracked here so downstream operations post creation can infer 47 | | // pct of `token` to distribute amongst delegated collaterals. For example, during liquidation we calc to total 48 | | // dollar value of delegated collateral and distribute the reward token proportionally to each collateral. 49 | | // 50 | | // There must be at least one pool collateral type available otherwise this reward distribute cannot distribute. 51 | | uint256 collateralTypesLength = self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes.length; 52 | | if (collateralTypesLength == 0) { 53 | | revert ParameterError.InvalidParameter("collateralTypes", "must not be empty"); 54 | | } 55 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < collateralTypesLength; ) { 56 | | if (self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes[i] == address(0)) { 57 | | revert AddressError.ZeroAddress(); 58 | | } 59 | | unchecked { 60 | | ++i; 61 | | } 62 | | } 63 | | } 64 | | 65 | | function setValidDistributor( 66 | | Data storage self, 67 | | address distributor, 68 | | address tokenAddress 69 | | ) internal { 70 | | if (distributor == address(0)) { 71 | | revert AddressError.ZeroAddress(); 72 | | } 73 | | 74 | | if ( 75 | | !ERC165Helper.safeSupportsInterface(distributor, type(IRewardDistributor).interfaceId) 76 | | ) { 77 | | revert IDistributorErrors.InvalidDistributorContract(distributor); 78 | | } 79 | | 80 | | if (RewardsDistributor(distributor).token() != tokenAddress) { 81 | | revert IDistributorErrors.InvalidDistributor(self.id, tokenAddress); 82 | | } 83 | | 84 | | self.distributor = distributor; 85 | | } 86 | | 87 | * | function distributeCollateral( 88 | | Data storage self, 89 | | address tokenAddress, 90 | | uint256 amount 91 | * | ) internal { 92 | * | RewardsDistributor distributor = RewardsDistributor(self.distributor); 93 | | 94 | * | if (distributor.token() != tokenAddress) { 95 | | revert IDistributorErrors.InvalidDistributor(self.id, tokenAddress); 96 | | } 97 | | 98 | * | uint256 poolCollateralTypesLength = self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes.length; 99 | * | ISynthetixSystem synthetix = PerpsMarketFactory.load().synthetix; 100 | | 101 | | // Transfer collateral to the distributor 102 | * | ITokenModule(tokenAddress).transfer(self.distributor, amount); 103 | | 104 | | // Calculate the USD value of each collateral delegated to pool. 105 | * | uint128 poolId = distributor.poolId(); 106 | * | uint256[] memory collateralValuesUsd = new uint256[](poolCollateralTypesLength); 107 | * | uint256 totalCollateralValueUsd; 108 | * | for (uint256 i = 0; i < poolCollateralTypesLength; ) { 109 | * | (, uint256 collateralValueUsd) = synthetix.getVaultCollateral( 110 | * | poolId, 111 | * | self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes[i] 112 | | ); 113 | * | totalCollateralValueUsd += collateralValueUsd; 114 | * | collateralValuesUsd[i] = collateralValueUsd; 115 | | 116 | | unchecked { 117 | * | ++i; 118 | | } 119 | | } 120 | | 121 | | // Infer the ratio of size to distribute, proportional to value of each delegated collateral. 122 | * | uint256 remainingAmountToDistribute = amount; 123 | * | for (uint256 j = 0; j < poolCollateralTypesLength; ) { 124 | | // Ensure total amounts fully distributed, the last collateral receives the remainder. 125 | * | if (j == poolCollateralTypesLength - 1) { 126 | * | distributor.distributeRewards( 127 | * | poolId, 128 | * | self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes[j], 129 | * | remainingAmountToDistribute, 130 | * | uint64(block.timestamp), // solhint-disable-line numcast/safe-cast 131 | | 0 132 | | ); 133 | | } else { 134 | | uint256 amountToDistribute = amount.mulDecimal( 135 | | collateralValuesUsd[j].divDecimal(totalCollateralValueUsd) 136 | | ); 137 | | remainingAmountToDistribute -= amountToDistribute; 138 | | distributor.distributeRewards( 139 | | poolId, 140 | | self.poolDelegatedCollateralTypes[j], 141 | | amountToDistribute, 142 | | uint64(block.timestamp), // solhint-disable-line numcast/safe-cast 143 | | 0 144 | | ); 145 | | } 146 | | 147 | | unchecked { 148 | * | ++j; 149 | | } 150 | | } 151 | | } 152 | | } 153 | |

23 | | 24 | * | uint128 constant SNX_USD_MARKET_ID = 0; 25 | | 26 | | /** 27 | | * @title Data for a single perps market 28 | | */ 29 | | library PerpsAccount { 30 | | using SetUtil for SetUtil.UintSet; 50 | | // @dev account Id 51 | | uint128 id; 52 | | // @dev set of active collateral types. 79 | | 80 | | error MaxCollateralsPerAccountReached(uint128 maxCollateralsPerAccount); 81 | | 82 | | error NonexistentDebt(uint128 accountId); 83 | | 84 | * | function load(uint128 id) internal pure returns (Data storage account) { 85 | * | bytes32 s = keccak256( 86 | * | abi.encode("io.synthetix.perps-market.Account", id) 87 | | ); 88 | | 89 | | assembly { 90 | | account.slot := s 91 | | } 92 | | } 93 | | 94 | | /** 95 | | @notice allows us to update the account id in case it needs to be 96 | | */ 97 | * | function create(uint128 id) internal returns (Data storage account) { 98 | * | account = load(id); 99 | * | if (account.id == 0) { 100 | * | account.id = id; 101 | | } 102 | | } 103 | | 104 | * | function validateMaxPositions( 105 | | uint128 accountId, 106 | | uint128 marketId 107 | | ) internal view { 108 | * | if (PerpsMarket.accountPosition(marketId, accountId).size == 0) { 109 | * | uint128 maxPositionsPerAccount = GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration 110 | | .load() 111 | | .maxPositionsPerAccount; 112 | * | if ( 113 | * | maxPositionsPerAccount <= 114 | * | load(accountId).openPositionMarketIds.length() 115 | | ) { 116 | | revert MaxPositionsPerAccountReached(maxPositionsPerAccount); 117 | | } 118 | | } 119 | | } 120 | | 121 | * | function validateMaxCollaterals( 122 | | uint128 accountId, 123 | | uint128 collateralId 124 | | ) internal view { 125 | * | Data storage account = load(accountId); 126 | | 127 | * | if (account.collateralAmounts[collateralId] == 0) { 128 | * | uint128 maxCollateralsPerAccount = GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration 129 | | .load() 130 | | .maxCollateralsPerAccount; 131 | * | if ( 132 | * | maxCollateralsPerAccount <= 133 | * | account.activeCollateralTypes.length() 134 | | ) { 135 | | revert MaxCollateralsPerAccountReached( 136 | | maxCollateralsPerAccount 137 | | ); 138 | | } 139 | | } 140 | | } 141 | | 142 | | /** 143 | | * @notice This function charges the account the specified amount 144 | | * @dev This is the only function that changes account debt. 145 | | * @dev Excess credit is added to account's snxUSD amount. 146 | | * @dev if the amount is positive, it is credit, if negative, it is debt. 147 | | */ 148 | * | function charge( 149 | | Data storage self, 150 | | int256 amount 151 | * | ) internal returns (uint256 debt) { 152 | * | uint256 newDebt; 153 | * | if (amount > 0) { 154 | * | int256 leftoverDebt = self.debt.toInt() - amount; 155 | * | if (leftoverDebt > 0) { 156 | * | newDebt = leftoverDebt.toUint(); 157 | | } else { 158 | * | newDebt = 0; 159 | * | updateCollateralAmount(self, SNX_USD_MARKET_ID, -leftoverDebt); 160 | | } 161 | * | } else { 162 | * | int256 creditAvailable = self 163 | | .collateralAmounts[SNX_USD_MARKET_ID] 164 | | .toInt(); 165 | * | int256 leftoverCredit = creditAvailable + amount; 166 | | 167 | * | if (leftoverCredit > 0) { 168 | * | updateCollateralAmount(self, SNX_USD_MARKET_ID, amount); 169 | | } else { 170 | * | updateCollateralAmount( 171 | * | self, 172 | | SNX_USD_MARKET_ID, 173 | * | -creditAvailable 174 | | ); 175 | * | newDebt = (self.debt.toInt() - leftoverCredit).toUint(); 176 | | } 177 | | } 178 | | 179 | * | return updateAccountDebt(self, newDebt.toInt() - self.debt.toInt()); 180 | | } 181 | | 182 | * | function updateAccountDebt( 183 | | Data storage self, 184 | | int256 amount 185 | * | ) internal returns (uint256 debt) { 186 | * | self.debt = (self.debt.toInt() + amount).toUint(); 187 | * | GlobalPerpsMarket.load().updateDebt(amount); 188 | | 189 | * | return self.debt; 190 | | } 191 | | 192 | * | function isEligibleForMarginLiquidation( 193 | | Data storage self, 194 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 195 | * | ) internal view returns (bool isEligible, int256 availableMargin) { 196 | * | availableMargin = getAvailableMargin(self, stalenessTolerance); 197 | * | isEligible = availableMargin < 0; 198 | | } 199 | | 200 | | // function isEligibleForLiquidation( 201 | | // Data storage self, 202 | | // PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 203 | | // ) 204 | | // internal 205 | | // view 206 | | // returns ( 207 | | // bool isEligible, 208 | | // int256 availableMargin, 209 | | // uint256 requiredInitialMargin, 210 | | // uint256 requiredMaintenanceMargin, 211 | | // uint256 liquidationReward 212 | | // ) 213 | | // { 214 | | // availableMargin = getAvailableMargin(self, stalenessTolerance); 215 | | 216 | | // ( 217 | | // requiredInitialMargin, 218 | | // requiredMaintenanceMargin, 219 | | // liquidationReward 220 | | // ) = getAccountRequiredMargins(self, stalenessTolerance); 221 | | // isEligible = (requiredMaintenanceMargin + liquidationReward).toInt() > availableMargin; 222 | | // } 223 | | 224 | * | function isEligibleForLiquidation( 225 | | Data storage self, 226 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 227 | | ) 228 | | internal 229 | | view 230 | | returns ( 231 | * | bool isEligible, 232 | * | int256 availableMargin, 233 | * | uint256 requiredInitialMargin, 234 | * | uint256 requiredMaintenanceMargin, 235 | * | uint256 liquidationReward 236 | | ) 237 | | { 238 | * | availableMargin = getAvailableMargin(self, stalenessTolerance); 239 | * | console2.log("availableMargin", availableMargin); 240 | | 241 | * | ( 242 | | requiredInitialMargin, 243 | | requiredMaintenanceMargin, 244 | | liquidationReward 245 | * | ) = getAccountRequiredMargins(self, stalenessTolerance); 246 | | 247 | * | console2.log("requiredInitialMargin", requiredInitialMargin); 248 | * | console2.log("requiredMaintenanceMargin", requiredMaintenanceMargin); 249 | * | console2.log("liquidationReward", liquidationReward); 250 | | 251 | * | isEligible = 252 | * | (requiredMaintenanceMargin + liquidationReward).toInt() > 253 | * | availableMargin; 254 | * | console2.log("isEligible", isEligible); 255 | | 256 | * | console2.log( 257 | | "(requiredMaintenanceMargin + liquidationReward).toInt()", 258 | * | (requiredMaintenanceMargin + liquidationReward).toInt() 259 | | ); 260 | | } 261 | | 262 | * | function flagForLiquidation( 263 | | Data storage self 264 | * | ) internal returns (uint256 flagKeeperCost, uint256 seizedMarginValue) { 265 | * | SetUtil.UintSet storage liquidatableAccounts = GlobalPerpsMarket 266 | | .load() 267 | | .liquidatableAccounts; 268 | | 269 | * | if (!liquidatableAccounts.contains(self.id)) { 270 | * | flagKeeperCost = KeeperCosts.load().getFlagKeeperCosts(self.id); 271 | * | liquidatableAccounts.add(self.id); 272 | * | seizedMarginValue = transferAllCollateral(self); 273 | * | AsyncOrder.load(self.id).reset(); 274 | | 275 | * | updateAccountDebt(self, -self.debt.toInt()); 276 | | } 277 | | } 278 | | 279 | * | function getMarginLiquidationCostAndSeizeMargin( 280 | | Data storage self 281 | | ) 282 | | internal 283 | * | returns (uint256 marginLiquidateCost, uint256 seizedMarginValue) 284 | | { 285 | | // notice: using getFlagKeeperCosts here since the logic is the same, but with no positions. 286 | * | marginLiquidateCost = KeeperCosts.load().getFlagKeeperCosts(self.id); 287 | | 288 | * | seizedMarginValue = transferAllCollateral(self); 289 | | } 290 | | 291 | * | function updateOpenPositions( 292 | | Data storage self, 293 | | uint256 positionMarketId, 294 | | int256 size 295 | | ) internal { 296 | * | if ( 297 | * | size == 0 && self.openPositionMarketIds.contains(positionMarketId) 298 | | ) { 299 | * | self.openPositionMarketIds.remove(positionMarketId); 300 | * | } else if (!self.openPositionMarketIds.contains(positionMarketId)) { 301 | * | self.openPositionMarketIds.add(positionMarketId); 302 | | } 303 | | } 304 | | 305 | * | function updateCollateralAmount( 306 | | Data storage self, 307 | | uint128 collateralId, 308 | | int256 amountDelta 309 | * | ) internal returns (uint256 collateralAmount) { 310 | * | collateralAmount = (self.collateralAmounts[collateralId].toInt() + 311 | * | amountDelta).toUint(); 312 | * | self.collateralAmounts[collateralId] = collateralAmount; 313 | | 314 | * | bool isActiveCollateral = self.activeCollateralTypes.contains( 315 | | collateralId 316 | | ); 317 | * | if (collateralAmount > 0 && !isActiveCollateral) { 318 | * | self.activeCollateralTypes.add(collateralId); 319 | * | } else if (collateralAmount == 0 && isActiveCollateral) { 320 | * | self.activeCollateralTypes.remove(collateralId); 321 | | } 322 | | 323 | | // always update global values when account collateral is changed 324 | * | GlobalPerpsMarket.load().updateCollateralAmount( 325 | * | collateralId, 326 | * | amountDelta 327 | | ); 328 | | } 329 | | 330 | * | function payDebt(Data storage self, uint256 amount) internal { 331 | * | if (self.debt == 0) { 332 | * | revert NonexistentDebt(self.id); 333 | | } 334 | | 335 | * | PerpsMarketFactory.Data storage perpsMarketFactory = PerpsMarketFactory 336 | | .load(); 337 | * | perpsMarketFactory.synthetix.depositMarketUsd( 338 | * | perpsMarketFactory.perpsMarketId, 339 | * | ERC2771Context._msgSender(), 340 | * | amount 341 | | ); 342 | | 343 | * | if (self.debt < amount) { 344 | * | self.debt = 0; 345 | * | updateCollateralAmount( 346 | | self, 347 | | SNX_USD_MARKET_ID, 348 | * | (amount - self.debt).toInt() 349 | | ); 350 | | } else { 351 | * | self.debt -= amount; 352 | | } 353 | | } 354 | | 355 | | /** 356 | | * @notice This function validates you have enough margin to withdraw without being liquidated. 357 | | * @dev This is done by checking your collateral value against your initial maintenance value. 358 | | * @dev It also checks the synth collateral for this account is enough to cover the withdrawal amount. 359 | | * @dev All price checks are not checking strict staleness tolerance. 360 | | */ 361 | * | function validateWithdrawableAmount( 362 | | Data storage self, 363 | | uint128 collateralId, 364 | | uint256 amountToWithdraw, 365 | | ISpotMarketSystem spotMarket 366 | | ) internal view { 367 | * | uint256 collateralAmount = self.collateralAmounts[collateralId]; 368 | * | if (collateralAmount < amountToWithdraw) { 369 | * | revert InsufficientSynthCollateral( 370 | | collateralId, 371 | | collateralAmount, 372 | | amountToWithdraw 373 | | ); 374 | | } 375 | | 376 | * | int256 withdrawableMarginUsd = getWithdrawableMargin( 377 | * | self, 378 | * | PerpsPrice.Tolerance.STRICT 379 | | ); 380 | | // Note: this can only happen if account is liquidatable 381 | * | if (withdrawableMarginUsd < 0) { 382 | * | revert AccountLiquidatable(self.id); 383 | | } 384 | | 385 | * | uint256 amountToWithdrawUsd; 386 | * | if (collateralId == SNX_USD_MARKET_ID) { 387 | * | amountToWithdrawUsd = amountToWithdraw; 388 | | } else { 389 | * | (amountToWithdrawUsd, ) = PerpsCollateralConfiguration 390 | * | .load(collateralId) 391 | | .valueInUsd( 392 | * | amountToWithdraw, 393 | * | spotMarket, 394 | * | PerpsPrice.Tolerance.STRICT, 395 | * | false 396 | | ); 397 | | } 398 | | 399 | * | if (amountToWithdrawUsd.toInt() > withdrawableMarginUsd) { 400 | * | revert InsufficientCollateralAvailableForWithdraw( 401 | | withdrawableMarginUsd, 402 | | amountToWithdrawUsd 403 | | ); 404 | | } 405 | | } 406 | | 407 | | /** 408 | | * @notice Withdrawable amount depends on if the account has active positions or not 409 | | * @dev If the account has no active positions and no debt, the withdrawable margin is the total collateral value 410 | | * @dev If the account has no active positions but has debt, the withdrawable margin is the available margin (which is debt reduced) 411 | | * @dev If the account has active positions, the withdrawable margin is the available margin - required margin - potential liquidation reward 412 | | */ 413 | * | function getWithdrawableMargin( 414 | | Data storage self, 415 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 416 | * | ) internal view returns (int256 withdrawableMargin) { 417 | * | bool hasActivePositions = hasOpenPositions(self); 418 | | 419 | | // not allowed to withdraw until debt is paid off fully. 420 | * | if (self.debt > 0) return 0; 421 | | 422 | * | if (hasActivePositions) { 423 | * | ( 424 | * | uint256 requiredInitialMargin, 425 | | , 426 | * | uint256 liquidationReward 427 | * | ) = getAccountRequiredMargins(self, stalenessTolerance); 428 | * | uint256 requiredMargin = requiredInitialMargin + liquidationReward; 429 | * | withdrawableMargin = 430 | * | getAvailableMargin(self, stalenessTolerance) - 431 | * | requiredMargin.toInt(); 432 | | } else { 433 | * | withdrawableMargin = getTotalCollateralValue( 434 | * | self, 435 | * | stalenessTolerance, 436 | * | false 437 | | ).toInt(); 438 | | } 439 | | } 440 | | 441 | * | function getTotalCollateralValue( 442 | | Data storage self, 443 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance, 444 | | bool useDiscountedValue 445 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256) { 446 | * | uint256 totalCollateralValue; 447 | * | ISpotMarketSystem spotMarket = PerpsMarketFactory.load().spotMarket; 448 | * | for (uint256 i = 1; i <= self.activeCollateralTypes.length(); i++) { 449 | * | uint128 collateralId = self 450 | | .activeCollateralTypes 451 | * | .valueAt(i) 452 | | .to128(); 453 | * | uint256 amount = self.collateralAmounts[collateralId]; 454 | | 455 | | uint256 amountToAdd; 456 | * | if (collateralId == SNX_USD_MARKET_ID) { 457 | * | amountToAdd = amount; 458 | | } else { 459 | * | (amountToAdd, ) = PerpsCollateralConfiguration 460 | * | .load(collateralId) 461 | | .valueInUsd( 462 | * | amount, 463 | * | spotMarket, 464 | * | stalenessTolerance, 465 | * | useDiscountedValue 466 | | ); 467 | | } 468 | * | totalCollateralValue += amountToAdd; 469 | | } 470 | * | return totalCollateralValue; 471 | | } 472 | | 473 | * | function getAccountPnl( 474 | | Data storage self, 475 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 476 | * | ) internal view returns (int256 totalPnl) { 477 | * | for (uint256 i = 1; i <= self.openPositionMarketIds.length(); i++) { 478 | * | uint128 marketId = self.openPositionMarketIds.valueAt(i).to128(); 479 | * | Position.Data storage position = PerpsMarket 480 | * | .load(marketId) 481 | * | .positions[self.id]; 482 | * | (int256 pnl, , , , , ) = position.getPnl( 483 | * | PerpsPrice.getCurrentPrice(marketId, stalenessTolerance) 484 | | ); 485 | * | totalPnl += pnl; 486 | | } 487 | | } 488 | | 489 | | /** 490 | | * @notice This function returns the available margin for an account (this is not withdrawable margin which takes into account, margin requirements for open positions) 491 | | * @dev The available margin is the total collateral value + account pnl - account debt 492 | | * @dev The total collateral value is always based on the discounted value of the collateral 493 | | */ 494 | * | function getAvailableMargin( 495 | | Data storage self, 496 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 497 | * | ) internal view returns (int256) { 498 | * | int256 totalCollateralValue = getTotalCollateralValue( 499 | * | self, 500 | * | stalenessTolerance, 501 | * | true 502 | | ).toInt(); 503 | * | int256 accountPnl = getAccountPnl(self, stalenessTolerance); 504 | | 505 | * | return totalCollateralValue + accountPnl - self.debt.toInt(); 506 | | } 507 | | 508 | * | function getTotalNotionalOpenInterest( 509 | | Data storage self 510 | | ) internal view returns (uint256 totalAccountOpenInterest) { 511 | * | for (uint256 i = 1; i <= self.openPositionMarketIds.length(); i++) { 512 | * | uint128 marketId = self.openPositionMarketIds.valueAt(i).to128(); 513 | | 514 | | Position.Data storage position = PerpsMarket 515 | | .load(marketId) 516 | | .positions[self.id]; 517 | | uint256 openInterest = position.getNotionalValue( 518 | | PerpsPrice.getCurrentPrice( 519 | | marketId, 520 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance.DEFAULT 521 | | ) 522 | | ); 523 | | totalAccountOpenInterest += openInterest; 524 | | } 525 | | } 526 | | 527 | | /** 528 | | * @notice This function returns the required margins for an account 529 | | * @dev The initial required margin is used to determine withdrawal amount and when opening positions 530 | | * @dev The maintenance margin is used to determine when to liquidate a position 531 | | */ 532 | | // function getAccountRequiredMargins( 533 | | // Data storage self, 534 | | // PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 535 | | // ) 536 | | // internal 537 | | // view 538 | | // returns ( 539 | | // uint256 initialMargin, 540 | | // uint256 maintenanceMargin, 541 | | // uint256 possibleLiquidationReward 542 | | // ) 543 | | // { 544 | | // uint256 openPositionMarketIdsLength = self 545 | | // .openPositionMarketIds 546 | | // .length(); 547 | | // if (openPositionMarketIdsLength == 0) { 548 | | // return (0, 0, 0); 549 | | // } 550 | | 551 | | // // use separate accounting for liquidation rewards so we can compare against global min/max liquidation reward values 552 | | // for (uint256 i = 1; 557 | | // PerpsMarketConfiguration.Data 558 | | // storage marketConfig = PerpsMarketConfiguration.load(marketId); 559 | | // ( 560 | | // , 561 | | // , 562 | | // uint256 positionInitialMargin, 563 | | // uint256 positionMaintenanceMargin 564 | | // ) = marketConfig.calculateRequiredMargins( 565 | | // position.size, 566 | | // PerpsPrice.getCurrentPrice(marketId, stalenessTolerance) 567 | | // ); 577 | | // possibleLiquidationReward = getPossibleLiquidationReward( 578 | | // self, 579 | | // accumulatedLiquidationRewards, 580 | | // maxNumberOfWindows 581 | | // ); 582 | | 583 | | // return (initialMargin, maintenanceMargin, possibleLiquidationReward); 584 | | // } 585 | | 586 | * | function getAccountRequiredMargins( 587 | | Data storage self, 588 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance 589 | | ) 590 | | internal 591 | | view 592 | | returns ( 593 | * | uint256 initialMargin, 594 | * | uint256 maintenanceMargin, 595 | * | uint256 possibleLiquidationReward 596 | | ) 597 | | { 598 | * | uint256 openPositionMarketIdsLength = self 599 | | .openPositionMarketIds 600 | | .length(); 675 | | } 676 | * | function getKeeperRewardsAndCosts( 677 | | Data storage self, 678 | | uint128 skipMarketId 679 | | ) 680 | | internal 681 | | view 682 | | returns ( 683 | * | uint256 accumulatedLiquidationRewards, 684 | | uint256 maxNumberOfWindows 685 | | ) 686 | | { 687 | | // use separate accounting for liquidation rewards so we can compare against global min/max liquidation reward values 688 | * | for (uint256 i = 1; 741 | | // } 742 | | 743 | * | function getPossibleLiquidationReward( 744 | | Data storage self, 745 | | uint256 accumulatedLiquidationRewards, 746 | | uint256 numOfWindows 747 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256 possibleLiquidationReward) { 748 | * | console2.log( 749 | | "accumulatedLiquidationRewards", 750 | * | accumulatedLiquidationRewards 751 | | ); 752 | * | console2.log("numOfWindows", numOfWindows); 753 | | 754 | * | GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration.Data 755 | * | storage globalConfig = GlobalPerpsMarketConfiguration.load(); 756 | | 757 | * | KeeperCosts.Data storage keeperCosts = KeeperCosts.load(); 758 | | 759 | * | uint256 costOfFlagging = keeperCosts.getFlagKeeperCosts(self.id); 760 | * | console2.log("costOfFlagging", costOfFlagging); 761 | | 762 | * | uint256 costOfLiquidation = keeperCosts.getLiquidateKeeperCosts(); 763 | * | console2.log("costOfLiquidation", costOfLiquidation); 764 | | 765 | * | uint256 totalCollateralValue = getTotalCollateralValue( 766 | * | self, 767 | * | PerpsPrice.Tolerance.DEFAULT, 768 | * | false 769 | | ); 770 | * | console2.log("totalCollateralValue", totalCollateralValue); 771 | | 772 | * | uint256 liquidateAndFlagCost = globalConfig.keeperReward( 773 | * | accumulatedLiquidationRewards, 774 | * | costOfFlagging, 775 | * | totalCollateralValue 776 | | ); 777 | * | console2.log("liquidateAndFlagCost", liquidateAndFlagCost); 778 | | 779 | * | uint256 liquidateWindowsCosts = numOfWindows == 0 780 | | ? 0 781 | * | : globalConfig.keeperReward(0, costOfLiquidation, 0) * 782 | * | (numOfWindows - 1); 783 | * | console2.log("liquidateWindowsCosts", liquidateWindowsCosts); 784 | | 785 | * | possibleLiquidationReward = 786 | * | liquidateAndFlagCost + 787 | * | liquidateWindowsCosts; 788 | * | console2.log("possibleLiquidationReward", possibleLiquidationReward); 789 | | 790 | * | return possibleLiquidationReward; 791 | | } 792 | | 793 | * | function transferAllCollateral( 794 | | Data storage self 795 | * | ) internal returns (uint256 seizedCollateralValue) { 796 | * | uint256[] memory activeCollateralTypes = self 797 | | .activeCollateralTypes 798 | | .values(); 799 | | 800 | * | for (uint256 i = 0; i < activeCollateralTypes.length; i++) { 801 | * | uint128 collateralId = activeCollateralTypes[i].to128(); 802 | * | if (collateralId == SNX_USD_MARKET_ID) { 803 | * | seizedCollateralValue += self.collateralAmounts[collateralId]; 804 | | } else { 805 | | // transfer to liquidation asset manager 806 | * | seizedCollateralValue += PerpsMarketFactory 807 | | .load() 808 | | .transferLiquidatedSynth( 809 | * | collateralId, 810 | * | self.collateralAmounts[collateralId] 811 | | ); 812 | | } 813 | | 814 | * | updateCollateralAmount( 815 | * | self, 816 | * | collateralId, 817 | * | -(self.collateralAmounts[collateralId].toInt()) 818 | | ); 819 | | } 820 | | } 821 | | 822 | * | function liquidatePosition( 823 | | Data storage self, 824 | | uint128 marketId, 825 | | uint256 price 826 | | ) 827 | | internal 828 | | returns ( 829 | * | uint128 amountToLiquidate, 830 | * | int128 newPositionSize, 831 | * | int128 sizeDelta, 832 | * | uint128 oldPositionAbsSize, 833 | * | MarketUpdate.Data memory marketUpdateData 834 | | ) 835 | | { 836 | * | PerpsMarket.Data storage perpsMarket = PerpsMarket.load(marketId); 837 | * | Position.Data storage position = perpsMarket.positions[self.id]; 838 | | 839 | * | perpsMarket.recomputeFunding(price); 840 | | 841 | * | int128 oldPositionSize = position.size; 842 | * | oldPositionAbsSize = MathUtil.abs128(oldPositionSize); 843 | * | amountToLiquidate = perpsMarket.maxLiquidatableAmount( 844 | | oldPositionAbsSize 845 | | ); 846 | | 847 | * | if (amountToLiquidate == 0) { 848 | * | return ( 849 | * | 0, 850 | * | oldPositionSize, 851 | | 0, 852 | | oldPositionAbsSize, 853 | | marketUpdateData 854 | | ); 855 | | } 856 | | 857 | * | int128 amtToLiquidationInt = amountToLiquidate.toInt(); 858 | | // reduce position size 859 | * | newPositionSize = oldPositionSize > 0 860 | * | ? oldPositionSize - amtToLiquidationInt 861 | * | : oldPositionSize + amtToLiquidationInt; 862 | | 863 | | // create new position in case of partial liquidation 864 | | Position.Data memory newPosition; 865 | * | if (newPositionSize != 0) { 866 | * | newPosition = Position.Data({ 867 | * | marketId: marketId, 868 | * | latestInteractionPrice: price.to128(), 869 | * | latestInteractionFunding: perpsMarket.lastFundingValue.to128(), 870 | * | latestInterestAccrued: 0, 871 | * | size: newPositionSize 872 | | }); 873 | | } 874 | | 875 | | // update position markets 876 | * | updateOpenPositions(self, marketId, newPositionSize); 877 | | 878 | | // update market data 879 | * | marketUpdateData = perpsMarket.updatePositionData(self.id, newPosition); 880 | * | sizeDelta = newPositionSize - oldPositionSize; 881 | | 882 | * | return ( 883 | | amountToLiquidate, 884 | | newPositionSize, 885 | | sizeDelta, 886 | | oldPositionAbsSize, 887 | | marketUpdateData 888 | | ); 889 | | } 890 | | 891 | * | function hasOpenPositions(Data storage self) internal view returns (bool) { 892 | * | return self.openPositionMarketIds.length() > 0; 893 | | } 894 | | } 895 | |
/Users/vladimirdzotov/Dropbox/do/GA/synthetix/synthetix-perps-minimal/markets/perps-market/contracts/storage/PerpsCollateralConfiguration.sol 1 | | //SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.8.11 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | import {DecimalMath} from "@synthetixio/core-contracts/contracts/utils/DecimalMath.sol"; 5 | | import {MathUtil} from "../utils/MathUtil.sol"; 6 | | import {PerpsPrice} from "./PerpsPrice.sol"; 7 | | import {Price} from "@synthetixio/spot-market/contracts/storage/Price.sol"; 8 | | import {ISpotMarketSystem} from "../interfaces/external/ISpotMarketSystem.sol"; 9 | | import {LiquidationAssetManager} from "./LiquidationAssetManager.sol"; 10 | | import {SNX_USD_MARKET_ID} from "./PerpsAccount.sol"; 11 | | 12 | | /** 13 | | * @title Configuration of all multi collateral assets used for trader margin 14 | | */ 15 | | library PerpsCollateralConfiguration { 16 | | using DecimalMath for uint256; 17 | | 18 | | /** 19 | | * @notice Thrown when attempting to access a not registered id 20 | | */ 21 | | error InvalidId(uint128 id); 22 | | 23 | | struct Data { 24 | | /** 25 | | * @dev Collateral Id 26 | | */ 27 | | uint128 id; 28 | | /** 29 | | * @dev Max amount of collateral that can be used for margin 30 | | */ 31 | | uint256 maxAmount; 32 | | /** 33 | | * @dev Collateral value is discounted and capped at this value. In % units. 34 | | */ 35 | | uint256 upperLimitDiscount; 36 | | /** 37 | | * @dev Collateral value is discounted and at minimum, this value. In % units. 38 | | */ 39 | | uint256 lowerLimitDiscount; 40 | | /** 41 | | * @dev This value is used to scale the impactOnSkew of the collateral. 42 | | */ 43 | | uint256 discountScalar; 44 | | /** 45 | | * @dev Liquidation Asset Manager data. (see LiquidationAssetManager.Data struct). 46 | | */ 47 | | LiquidationAssetManager.Data lam; 48 | | } 49 | | 50 | | /** 51 | | * @dev Load the collateral configuration data using collateral/synth id 52 | | */ 53 | * | function load(uint128 collateralId) internal pure returns (Data storage collateralConfig) { 54 | * | bytes32 s = keccak256( 55 | * | abi.encode("io.synthetix.perps-market.CollateralConfiguration", collateralId) 56 | | ); 57 | | assembly { 58 | | collateralConfig.slot := s 59 | | } 60 | | } 61 | | 62 | | /** 63 | | * @dev Load a valid collateral configuration data using collateral/synth id 64 | | */ 65 | | function loadValid(uint128 collateralId) internal view returns (Data storage collateralConfig) { 66 | | collateralConfig = load(collateralId); 67 | | if (collateralConfig.id == 0) { 68 | | revert InvalidId(collateralId); 69 | | } 70 | | } 71 | | 72 | | /** 73 | | * @dev Load a valid collateral LiquidationAssetManager configuration data using collateral/synth id 74 | | */ 75 | * | function loadValidLam( 76 | | uint128 collateralId 77 | * | ) internal view returns (LiquidationAssetManager.Data storage collateralLAMConfig) { 78 | * | collateralLAMConfig = load(collateralId).lam; 79 | * | if (collateralLAMConfig.id == 0) { 80 | | revert InvalidId(collateralId); 81 | | } 82 | | } 83 | | 84 | * | function validDistributorExists(uint128 collateralId) internal view returns (bool) { 85 | * | return 86 | * | (collateralId == SNX_USD_MARKET_ID) || 87 | * | (loadValidLam(collateralId).distributor != address(0)); 88 | | } 89 | | 90 | | function setMax(Data storage self, uint128 collateralId, uint256 maxAmount) internal { 91 | | if (self.id == 0) self.id = collateralId; 92 | | self.maxAmount = maxAmount; 93 | | } 94 | | 95 | | function setDiscounts( 96 | | Data storage self, 97 | | uint256 upperLimitDiscount, 98 | | uint256 lowerLimitDiscount, 99 | | uint256 discountScalar 100 | | ) internal { 101 | | self.upperLimitDiscount = upperLimitDiscount; 102 | | self.lowerLimitDiscount = lowerLimitDiscount; 103 | | self.discountScalar = discountScalar; 104 | | } 105 | | 106 | | function getConfig( 107 | | Data storage self 108 | | ) 109 | | internal 110 | | view 111 | | returns ( 112 | | uint256 maxAmount, 113 | | uint256 upperLimitDiscount, 114 | | uint256 lowerLimitDiscount, 115 | | uint256 discountScalar 116 | | ) 117 | | { 118 | | maxAmount = self.maxAmount; 119 | | upperLimitDiscount = self.upperLimitDiscount; 120 | | lowerLimitDiscount = self.lowerLimitDiscount; 121 | | discountScalar = self.discountScalar; 122 | | } 123 | | 124 | | function isSupported(Data storage self) internal view returns (bool) { 125 | | return self.maxAmount != 0; 126 | | } 127 | | 128 | * | function valueInUsd( 129 | | Data storage self, 130 | | uint256 amount, 131 | | ISpotMarketSystem spotMarket, 132 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance stalenessTolerance, 133 | | bool useDiscount 134 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256 collateralValueInUsd, uint256 discount) { 135 | * | uint256 skewScale = spotMarket.getMarketSkewScale(self.id); 136 | | // only discount collateral if skew scale is set on spot market and useDiscount is set to true 137 | * | if (useDiscount && skewScale != 0) { 138 | * | uint256 impactOnSkew = amount.divDecimal(skewScale).mulDecimal(self.discountScalar); 139 | * | discount = ( 140 | * | MathUtil.max( 141 | * | MathUtil.min(impactOnSkew, self.lowerLimitDiscount), 142 | * | self.upperLimitDiscount 143 | | ) 144 | | ); 145 | | } 146 | | // first get value of collateral in usd 147 | * | uint128 sellTxnType = 2; 148 | * | uint256 collateralPrice = spotMarket.indexPrice( 149 | * | self.id, 150 | | sellTxnType, 151 | * | Price.Tolerance(uint256(stalenessTolerance)) // solhint-disable-line numcast/safe-cast 152 | | ); 153 | * | uint256 valueWithoutDiscount = amount.mulDecimal(collateralPrice); 154 | | 155 | | // if discount is 0, this just gets multiplied by 1 156 | * | collateralValueInUsd = valueWithoutDiscount.mulDecimal(DecimalMath.UNIT - discount); 157 | | } 158 | | } 159 | |

17 | | 18 | | /** 19 | | * @title Data for a single perps market 20 | | */ 21 | | library PerpsMarket { 22 | | using DecimalMath for int256; 23 | | using DecimalMath for uint256; 24 | | using SafeCastI256 for int256; 44 | | 45 | | struct Data { 46 | | string name; 47 | | string symbol; 48 | | uint128 id; 49 | | int256 skew; 50 | | uint256 size; 51 | | int256 lastFundingRate; 52 | | int256 lastFundingValue; 53 | | uint256 lastFundingTime; 54 | | // solhint-disable-next-line var-name-mixedcase 55 | | uint128 __unused_1; 56 | | // solhint-disable-next-line var-name-mixedcase 57 | | uint128 __unused_2; 58 | | // debt calculation 59 | | // accumulates total notional size of the market including accrued funding until the last time any position changed 60 | | int256 debtCorrectionAccumulator; 61 | | // accountId => asyncOrder 62 | | mapping(uint256 => AsyncOrder.Data) asyncOrders; 63 | | // accountId => position 64 | | mapping(uint256 => Position.Data) positions; 65 | | // liquidation amounts 66 | | Liquidation.Data[] liquidationData; 67 | | } 68 | | 69 | * | function load( 70 | | uint128 marketId 71 | * | ) internal pure returns (Data storage market) { 72 | * | bytes32 s = keccak256( 73 | * | abi.encode("io.synthetix.perps-market.PerpsMarket", marketId) 74 | | ); 75 | | 76 | | assembly { 77 | | market.slot := s 78 | | } 79 | | } 80 | | 81 | | function createValid( 82 | | uint128 id, 83 | | string memory name, 84 | | string memory symbol 85 | | ) internal returns (Data storage market) { 86 | | if (id == 0 || load(id).id == id) { 87 | | revert InvalidMarket(id); 88 | | } 89 | | 90 | | market = load(id); 91 | | 92 | | market.id = id; 93 | | market.name = name; 94 | | market.symbol = symbol; 95 | | } 96 | | 97 | | /** 98 | | * @dev Reverts if the market does not exist with appropriate error. Otherwise, returns the market. 99 | | */ 100 | * | function loadValid( 101 | | uint128 marketId 102 | * | ) internal view returns (Data storage market) { 103 | * | market = load(marketId); 104 | * | if (market.id == 0) { 105 | | revert InvalidMarket(marketId); 106 | | } 107 | | 108 | * | if (PerpsPrice.load(marketId).feedId == "") { 109 | | revert PriceFeedNotSet(marketId); 110 | | } 111 | | 112 | * | if (KeeperCosts.load().keeperCostNodeId == "") { 113 | | revert KeeperCostsNotSet(); 114 | | } 115 | | } 116 | | 117 | | /** 118 | | * @dev Returns the max amount of liquidation that can occur based on the market configuration 119 | | * @notice Based on the configured liquidation window, a trader can only be liquidated for a certain 120 | | * amount within that window. If the amount requested is greater than the amount allowed, the 121 | | * smaller amount is returned. The function also updates its accounting to ensure the results on 122 | | * subsequent liquidations work appropriately. 123 | | */ 124 | * | function maxLiquidatableAmount( 125 | | Data storage self, 126 | | uint128 requestedLiquidationAmount 127 | * | ) internal returns (uint128 liquidatableAmount) { 128 | * | PerpsMarketConfiguration.Data 129 | * | storage marketConfig = PerpsMarketConfiguration.load(self.id); 130 | | 131 | | // if endorsedLiquidator is configured and is the sender, allow full liquidation 132 | * | if (ERC2771Context._msgSender() == marketConfig.endorsedLiquidator) { 133 | | _updateLiquidationData(self, requestedLiquidationAmount); 134 | | return requestedLiquidationAmount; 135 | | } 136 | | 137 | * | ( 138 | * | uint256 liquidationCapacity, 139 | * | uint256 maxLiquidationInWindow, 140 | * | uint256 latestLiquidationTimestamp 141 | * | ) = currentLiquidationCapacity(self, marketConfig); 142 | | 143 | | // this would only occur if there was a misconfiguration (like skew scale not being set) 144 | | // or the max liquidation window not being set etc. 145 | | // in this case, return the entire requested liquidation amount 146 | * | if (maxLiquidationInWindow == 0) { 147 | | return requestedLiquidationAmount; 148 | | } 149 | | 150 | * | uint256 maxLiquidationPd = marketConfig.maxLiquidationPd; 151 | | // if liquidation capacity exists, update accordingly 152 | * | if (liquidationCapacity != 0) { 153 | * | liquidatableAmount = MathUtil.min128( 154 | * | liquidationCapacity.to128(), 155 | * | requestedLiquidationAmount 156 | | ); 157 | * | } else if ( 158 | * | maxLiquidationPd != 0 && 159 | | // only allow this if the last update was not in the current block 160 | | latestLiquidationTimestamp != block.timestamp 161 | | ) { 162 | | /** 163 | | if capacity is at 0, but the market is under configured liquidation p/d, 164 | | another block of liquidation becomes allowable. 165 | | */ 166 | * | uint256 currentPd = MathUtil.abs(self.skew).divDecimal( 167 | | marketConfig.skewScale 168 | | ); 169 | | if (currentPd < maxLiquidationPd) { 170 | | liquidatableAmount = MathUtil.min128( 171 | | maxLiquidationInWindow.to128(), 172 | | requestedLiquidationAmount 173 | | ); 174 | | } 175 | | } 176 | | 177 | * | if (liquidatableAmount > 0) { 178 | * | _updateLiquidationData(self, liquidatableAmount); 179 | | } 180 | | } 181 | | 182 | * | function _updateLiquidationData( 183 | | Data storage self, 184 | | uint128 liquidationAmount 185 | * | ) private { 186 | * | uint256 liquidationDataLength = self.liquidationData.length; 187 | * | uint256 currentTimestamp = liquidationDataLength == 0 188 | * | ? 0 189 | * | : self.liquidationData[liquidationDataLength - 1].timestamp; 190 | | 191 | * | if (currentTimestamp == block.timestamp) { 192 | * | self 193 | * | .liquidationData[liquidationDataLength - 1] 194 | * | .amount += liquidationAmount; 195 | | } else { 196 | * | self.liquidationData.push( 197 | * | Liquidation.Data({ 198 | | amount: liquidationAmount, 199 | * | timestamp: block.timestamp 200 | | }) 201 | | ); 202 | | } 203 | | } 204 | | 205 | | /** 206 | | * @dev Returns the current liquidation capacity for the market 207 | | * @notice This function sums up the liquidation amounts in the current liquidation window 208 | | * and returns the capacity left. 209 | | */ 210 | | // function currentLiquidationCapacity( 211 | | // Data storage self, 212 | | // PerpsMarketConfiguration.Data storage marketConfig 213 | | // ) 214 | | // internal 215 | | // view 216 | | // returns ( 217 | | // uint256 capacity, 218 | | // uint256 maxLiquidationInWindow, 219 | | // uint256 latestLiquidationTimestamp 220 | | // ) 221 | | // { 222 | | // maxLiquidationInWindow = marketConfig.maxLiquidationAmountInWindow(); 223 | | // uint256 accumulatedLiquidationAmounts; 224 | | // uint256 liquidationDataLength = self.liquidationData.length; 225 | | // if (liquidationDataLength == 0) 226 | | // return (maxLiquidationInWindow, maxLiquidationInWindow, 0); 227 | | 228 | | // uint256 currentIndex = liquidationDataLength - 1; 229 | | // latestLiquidationTimestamp = self 230 | | // .liquidationData[currentIndex] 231 | | // .timestamp; 232 | | // uint256 windowStartTimestamp = block.timestamp - 233 | | // marketConfig.maxSecondsInLiquidationWindow; 234 | | 235 | | // while ( 236 | | // self.liquidationData[currentIndex].timestamp > windowStartTimestamp 237 | | // ) { 238 | | // accumulatedLiquidationAmounts += self 239 | | // .liquidationData[currentIndex] 240 | | // .amount; 241 | | 242 | | // if (currentIndex == 0) break; 243 | | // currentIndex--; 244 | | // } 245 | | // int256 availableLiquidationCapacity = maxLiquidationInWindow.toInt() - 246 | | // accumulatedLiquidationAmounts.toInt(); 247 | | // // solhint-disable-next-line numcast/safe-cast 248 | | // capacity = MathUtil 249 | | // .max(availableLiquidationCapacity, int256(0)) 250 | | // .toUint(); 251 | | // } 252 | | 253 | * | function currentLiquidationCapacity( 254 | | Data storage self, 255 | | PerpsMarketConfiguration.Data storage marketConfig 256 | | ) 257 | | internal 258 | | view 259 | | returns ( 260 | * | uint256 capacity, 261 | * | uint256 maxLiquidationInWindow, 262 | * | uint256 latestLiquidationTimestamp 263 | | ) 264 | * | { 265 | * | maxLiquidationInWindow = marketConfig.maxLiquidationAmountInWindow(); 266 | * | console2.log("maxLiquidationInWindow", maxLiquidationInWindow); 267 | | 268 | * | uint256 accumulatedLiquidationAmounts; 269 | * | console2.log( 270 | | "accumulatedLiquidationAmounts", 271 | * | accumulatedLiquidationAmounts 272 | | ); 273 | | 274 | * | uint256 liquidationDataLength = self.liquidationData.length; 275 | * | console2.log("liquidationDataLength", liquidationDataLength); 276 | | 277 | * | if (liquidationDataLength == 0) { 278 | * | console2.log("capacity", maxLiquidationInWindow); 279 | * | console2.log("maxLiquidationInWindow", maxLiquidationInWindow); 280 | * | return (maxLiquidationInWindow, maxLiquidationInWindow, 0); 281 | | } 282 | | 283 | * | uint256 currentIndex = liquidationDataLength - 1; 284 | * | console2.log("currentIndex", currentIndex); 285 | | 286 | * | latestLiquidationTimestamp = self 287 | * | .liquidationData[currentIndex] 288 | | .timestamp; 289 | * | console2.log("latestLiquidationTimestamp", latestLiquidationTimestamp); 290 | | 291 | * | uint256 windowStartTimestamp = block.timestamp - 292 | * | marketConfig.maxSecondsInLiquidationWindow; 293 | * | console2.log("windowStartTimestamp", windowStartTimestamp); 294 | * | console2.log("block.timestamp", block.timestamp); 295 | * | console2.log( 296 | | "marketConfig.maxSecondsInLiquidationWindow", 297 | * | marketConfig.maxSecondsInLiquidationWindow 298 | | ); 299 | | 300 | * | while ( 301 | * | self.liquidationData[currentIndex].timestamp > windowStartTimestamp 302 | | ) { 303 | * | console2.log( 304 | | "self.liquidationData[currentIndex].timestamp", 305 | * | self.liquidationData[currentIndex].timestamp 306 | | ); 307 | * | console2.log( 308 | | "self.liquidationData[currentIndex].amount", 309 | * | self.liquidationData[currentIndex].amount 310 | | ); 311 | | 312 | * | accumulatedLiquidationAmounts += self 313 | * | .liquidationData[currentIndex] 314 | | .amount; 315 | * | console2.log( 316 | | "accumulatedLiquidationAmounts", 317 | * | accumulatedLiquidationAmounts 318 | | ); 319 | | 320 | * | if (currentIndex == 0) break; 321 | * | currentIndex--; 322 | * | console2.log("currentIndex", currentIndex); 323 | | } 324 | | 325 | * | int256 availableLiquidationCapacity = maxLiquidationInWindow.toInt() - 326 | * | accumulatedLiquidationAmounts.toInt(); 327 | * | console2.log( 328 | | "availableLiquidationCapacity", 329 | * | availableLiquidationCapacity 330 | | ); 331 | | 332 | | // solhint-disable-next-line numcast/safe-cast 333 | * | capacity = MathUtil 334 | * | .max(availableLiquidationCapacity, int256(0)) 335 | | .toUint(); 336 | * | console2.log("capacity", capacity); 337 | | 338 | * | console2.log("Final maxLiquidationInWindow", maxLiquidationInWindow); 339 | * | console2.log( 340 | | "Final latestLiquidationTimestamp", 341 | * | latestLiquidationTimestamp 342 | | ); 343 | | } 344 | | 345 | | struct PositionDataRuntime { 346 | | uint256 currentPrice; 347 | | int256 sizeDelta; 348 | | int256 fundingDelta; 349 | | int256 notionalDelta; 350 | | } 351 | | 352 | | /** 353 | | * @dev Use this function to update both market/position size/skew. 354 | | * @dev Size and skew should not be updated directly. 355 | | * @dev The return value is used to emit a MarketUpdated event. 356 | | */ 357 | * | function updatePositionData( 358 | | Data storage self, 359 | | uint128 accountId, 360 | | Position.Data memory newPosition 361 | * | ) internal returns (MarketUpdate.Data memory) { 362 | * | PositionDataRuntime memory runtime; 363 | * | Position.Data storage oldPosition = self.positions[accountId]; 364 | | 365 | * | self.size = 366 | * | (self.size + MathUtil.abs128(newPosition.size)) - 367 | * | MathUtil.abs128(oldPosition.size); 368 | * | self.skew += newPosition.size - oldPosition.size; 369 | | 370 | * | runtime.currentPrice = newPosition.latestInteractionPrice; 371 | * | (, int256 pricePnl, , int256 fundingPnl, , ) = oldPosition.getPnl( 372 | | runtime.currentPrice 373 | | ); 374 | | 375 | * | runtime.sizeDelta = newPosition.size - oldPosition.size; 376 | * | runtime.fundingDelta = calculateNextFunding(self, runtime.currentPrice) 377 | | .mulDecimal(runtime.sizeDelta); 378 | * | runtime.notionalDelta = runtime.currentPrice.toInt().mulDecimal( 379 | * | runtime.sizeDelta 380 | | ); 381 | | 382 | | // update the market debt correction accumulator before losing oldPosition details 383 | | // by adding the new updated notional (old - new size) plus old position pnl 384 | * | self.debtCorrectionAccumulator += 385 | * | runtime.fundingDelta + 386 | | runtime.notionalDelta + 387 | * | pricePnl + 388 | * | fundingPnl; 389 | | 390 | | // update position to new position 391 | | // Note: once market interest rate is updated, the current accrued interest is saved 392 | | // to figure out the unrealized interest for the position 393 | | // when we update market size, use a 1 month price tolerance for calculating minimum credit 394 | * | (uint128 interestRate, uint256 currentInterestAccrued) = InterestRate 395 | * | .update(PerpsPrice.Tolerance.ONE_MONTH); 396 | | oldPosition.update(newPosition, currentInterestAccrued); 397 | | 398 | * | return 399 | * | MarketUpdate.Data( 400 | * | self.id, 401 | | interestRate, 402 | * | self.skew, 403 | * | self.size, 404 | * | self.lastFundingRate, 405 | * | currentFundingVelocity(self) 406 | | ); 407 | | } 408 | | 409 | * | function recomputeFunding( 410 | | Data storage self, 411 | | uint256 price 412 | * | ) internal returns (int256 fundingRate, int256 fundingValue) { 413 | * | fundingRate = currentFundingRate(self); 414 | * | fundingValue = calculateNextFunding(self, price); 415 | | 416 | * | self.lastFundingRate = fundingRate; 417 | * | self.lastFundingValue = fundingValue; 418 | * | self.lastFundingTime = block.timestamp; 419 | | 420 | | return (fundingRate, fundingValue); 421 | | } 422 | | 423 | * | function calculateNextFunding( 424 | | Data storage self, 425 | | uint256 price 426 | * | ) internal view returns (int256 nextFunding) { 427 | * | nextFunding = self.lastFundingValue + unrecordedFunding(self, price); 428 | | } 429 | | 430 | * | function unrecordedFunding( 431 | | Data storage self, 432 | | uint256 price 433 | * | ) internal view returns (int256) { 434 | * | int256 fundingRate = currentFundingRate(self); 435 | | // note the minus sign: funding flows in the opposite direction to the skew. 436 | * | int256 avgFundingRate = -(self.lastFundingRate + fundingRate) 437 | * | .divDecimal((DecimalMath.UNIT * 2).toInt()); 438 | | 439 | | return 440 | * | avgFundingRate.mulDecimal(proportionalElapsed(self)).mulDecimal( 441 | * | price.toInt() 442 | | ); 443 | | } 444 | | 445 | * | function currentFundingRate( 446 | | Data storage self 447 | * | ) internal view returns (int256) { 448 | | // calculations: 449 | | // - velocity = proportional_skew * max_funding_velocity 450 | | // - proportional_skew = skew / skew_scale 451 | | // 452 | | // example: 453 | | // - prev_funding_rate = 0 454 | | // - prev_velocity = 0.0025 455 | | // - time_delta = 29,000s 456 | | // - max_funding_velocity = 0.025 (2.5%) 457 | | // - skew = 300 458 | | // - skew_scale = 10,000 459 | | // 460 | | // note: prev_velocity just refs to the velocity _before_ modifying the market skew. 461 | | // 462 | | // funding_rate = prev_funding_rate + prev_velocity * (time_delta / seconds_in_day) 463 | | // funding_rate = 0 + 0.0025 * (29,000 / 86,400) 464 | | // = 0 + 0.0025 * 0.33564815 465 | | // = 0.00083912 466 | | return 467 | * | self.lastFundingRate + 468 | | ( 469 | * | currentFundingVelocity(self).mulDecimal( 470 | * | proportionalElapsed(self) 471 | | ) 472 | | ); 473 | | } 474 | | 475 | * | function currentFundingVelocity( 476 | | Data storage self 477 | * | ) internal view returns (int256) { 478 | * | PerpsMarketConfiguration.Data 479 | * | storage marketConfig = PerpsMarketConfiguration.load(self.id); 480 | * | int256 maxFundingVelocity = marketConfig.maxFundingVelocity.toInt(); 481 | * | int256 skewScale = marketConfig.skewScale.toInt(); 482 | | // Avoid a panic due to div by zero. Return 0 immediately. 483 | * | if (skewScale == 0) { 484 | * | return 0; 485 | | } 486 | | // Ensures the proportionalSkew is between -1 and 1. 487 | * | int256 pSkew = self.skew.divDecimal(skewScale); 488 | * | int256 pSkewBounded = MathUtil.min( 489 | * | MathUtil.max(-(DecimalMath.UNIT).toInt(), pSkew), 490 | * | (DecimalMath.UNIT).toInt() 491 | | ); 492 | * | return pSkewBounded.mulDecimal(maxFundingVelocity); 493 | | } 494 | | 495 | * | function proportionalElapsed( 496 | | Data storage self 497 | * | ) internal view returns (int256) { 498 | | // even though timestamps here are not D18, divDecimal multiplies by 1e18 to preserve decimals into D18 499 | | return 500 | * | (block.timestamp - self.lastFundingTime).divDecimal(1 days).toInt(); 501 | | } 502 | | 503 | * | function validatePositionSize( 504 | | Data storage self, 505 | | uint256 maxSize, 506 | | uint256 maxValue, 507 | | uint256 price, 508 | | int128 oldSize, 509 | | int128 newSize 510 | * | ) internal view { 511 | | // Allow users to reduce an order no matter the market conditions. 512 | * | bool isReducingInterest = MathUtil.isSameSideReducing(oldSize, newSize); 513 | * | if (!isReducingInterest) { 514 | * | int256 newSkew = self.skew - oldSize + newSize; 515 | | 516 | * | int256 newMarketSize = self.size.toInt() - 517 | * | MathUtil.abs(oldSize).toInt() + 518 | * | MathUtil.abs(newSize).toInt(); 519 | | 520 | * | int256 newSideSize; 521 | * | if (0 < newSize) { 522 | | // long case: marketSize + skew 523 | | // = (|longSize| + |shortSize|) + (longSize + shortSize) 524 | | // = 2 * longSize 525 | * | newSideSize = newMarketSize + newSkew; 526 | | } else { 527 | | // short case: marketSize - skew 528 | | // = (|longSize| + |shortSize|) - (longSize + shortSize) 529 | | // = 2 * -shortSize 530 | * | newSideSize = newMarketSize - newSkew; 531 | | } 532 | | 533 | | // newSideSize still includes an extra factor of 2 here, so we will divide by 2 in the actual condition 534 | * | if (maxSize < MathUtil.abs(newSideSize / 2)) { 535 | * | revert PerpsMarketConfiguration.MaxOpenInterestReached( 536 | * | self.id, 537 | * | maxSize, 538 | * | newSideSize / 2 539 | | ); 540 | | } 541 | | 542 | | // same check but with value (size * price) 543 | | // note that if maxValue param is set to 0, this validation is skipped 544 | * | if ( 545 | * | maxValue > 0 && 546 | | maxValue < MathUtil.abs(newSideSize / 2).mulDecimal(price) 547 | | ) { 548 | | revert PerpsMarketConfiguration.MaxUSDOpenInterestReached( 549 | | self.id, 550 | | maxValue, 551 | | newSideSize / 2, 552 | | price 553 | | ); 554 | | } 555 | | } 556 | | } 557 | | 558 | | /** 559 | | * @dev Returns the market debt incurred by all positions 560 | | * @notice Market debt is the sum of all position sizes multiplied by the price, and old positions pnl that is included in the debt correction accumulator. 561 | | */ 562 | * | function marketDebt( 563 | | Data storage self, 564 | | uint256 price 565 | * | ) internal view returns (int256) { 566 | | // all positions sizes multiplied by the price is equivalent to skew times price 567 | | // and the debt correction accumulator is the sum of all positions pnl 568 | * | int256 positionPnl = self.skew.mulDecimal(price.toInt()); 569 | * | int256 fundingPnl = self.skew.mulDecimal( 570 | * | calculateNextFunding(self, price) 571 | | ); 572 | | 573 | * | return positionPnl + fundingPnl - self.debtCorrectionAccumulator; 574 | | } 575 | | 576 | * | function requiredCredit( 577 | | uint128 marketId, 578 | | PerpsPrice.Tolerance tolerance 579 | * | ) internal view returns (uint256) { 580 | | return 581 | * | PerpsMarket 582 | * | .load(marketId) 583 | | .size 584 | * | .mulDecimal(PerpsPrice.getCurrentPrice(marketId, tolerance)) 585 | | .mulDecimal( 586 | * | PerpsMarketConfiguration.load(marketId).lockedOiRatioD18 587 | | ); 588 | | } 589 | | 590 | * | function accountPosition( 591 | | uint128 marketId, 592 | | uint128 accountId 593 | * | ) internal view returns (Position.Data storage position) { 594 | * | position = load(marketId).positions[accountId]; 595 | | } 596 | | } 597 | |
